opportunities.title: Coastal Marine Scientist — Graduate/Early Career
opportunities.description: A global environmental consultancy is seeking a Graduate Coastal Engineer or Marine Scientist to join their Oceans and Environmental team. This position involves working on marine environmental projects including offshore renewable energy developments and environmental risk assessments. Ideal candidates will have a relevant degree and be eager to develop their skills in a collaborative environment. Opportunities for training and professional development are provided.

opportunities.title: Marine Fisheries Field Scientist I – Tequesta
opportunities.description:
A state agency in Florida is seeking an OPS Biological Scientist I to conduct research and monitoring of recreational fisheries. This role involves data collection, dockside interviews, and biological sampling. A bachelor's degree in biological sciences is required. The position offers $21/hour and is contingent upon a successful background check. Candidates must be flexible, working weekends and holidays as needed. Comprehensive benefits are available.

opportunities.title: Research Assistant I
opportunities.description:
Job Details

Description

Position Summary:

A full-time Research Assistant I position is available to work in the labs of Dr Rawlinson and Dr Gillis in the Bay Paul Center for Comparative Molecular Biology and Evolution at the MBL.

The RA1 will assist with research on several on-going projects to do with parasitology (Rawlinson lab) and skeletal biology (Gillis lab).

opportunities.title: Individual Placement – Fisheries And Marine Biology
opportunities.description:
Position Summary

The natural resources intern will provide support with surveying, monitoring, reporting, mapping, and data management for the US Navy in the northwest region. The navy manages over 70,000 acres of land in the northwest region with ongoing forage fish, salmonid, marine mammal, raptor nest, bat, and forestry surveys. opportunities.description:
